intro: Amsinckia angustisepala, commonly known as the narrow-lobed fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Amsinckia angustisepala is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
